description: From Proto-Germanic *spannō, from Proto-Indo-European *(s)pend-. Cognate with Middle Dutch spanne (Dutch spanne), Old High German spanna (German Spanne), Old Norse spǫnn (Icelandic spönn).

nouns.description: spann f (nominative plural spanna or spanne)

entries.meaning: span (of a hand; used as a measurement, typically considered about nine inches)
